page.title: 10LIVING IN THE COUNTRY
page.content: DISADVANTAGES OF LIVING IN BEENHAM. Lack of shops, bus services, street lights and entertainments.You need a car to take part in leisure activities as there are very few recreational facilities. Roads stay blocked long after it snows. The library van calls only once a fortnight. Older people have to depend on delivery vans. There is no gas supply and frequent power cuts.The local secondary school is quite a distance away. ADVANTAGES OF LIVING IN BEENHAM. There are no riots and very little vandalism.There are open spaces, woods and a small friendly school. There is less noise,superb views with plenty of unspoilt land. The people are friendly and have plenty of places to walk.In Beenham wild life is abundant. Local grown vegetables, fruit and fresh eggs are available.
